code_events.event:
Called when the callback receives a message. It is called after the message has benn saved in the database.

Callback signature:

ThreemaGateway_Handler_Action_Callback $handler, Threema\MsgApi\Helpers\ReceiveMessageResult $receiveResult, Threema\MsgApi\Messages\ThreemaMessage $threemaMsg, array|string &$output, $messageSaved, $debugMode

Arguments:

  1. ThreemaGateway_Handler_Action_Callback $handler - the callback handler triggering this
  2. Threema\MsgApi\Helpers\ReceiveMessageResult $receiveResult - Threema PHP-SDK receive result.
  3. Threema\MsgApi\Messages\ThreemaMessage $threemaMsg - Threema PHP-SDK message result.
  4. array|string &$output - The output, which is later written to log and potentially shown to Threema. Can be modified, but please only append strings. Array format: [$logType, $debugLog, $publicLog].
  5. bool $messageSaved - If true the message has been saved to the database.
    Note: Even when disabled, the message ID is always saved in the database (for security reasons).
  6. bool $debugMode - Whether the debug mode is activated.

Event Hint: Message type ID (see ThreemaGateway_Model_Messages) of the message processed. As you cannot use constants here, enter the integer value here.

Called when the callback receives a message. It is called before the message is saved and therefore you can even prevent message savings if needed.

Note: Before the message is saved in the database it is not guaranteed that replay attacks do not happen. Depending on what you do, you may consider to query the database ($handler->assertNoReplayAttack($messageId)) to ensure that it is not already saved.

Callback signature:

ThreemaGateway_Handler_Action_Callback $handler, Threema\MsgApi\Helpers\ReceiveMessageResult $receiveResult, Threema\MsgApi\Messages\ThreemaMessage $threemaMsg, array|string &$output, &$saveMessage, $debugMode

Arguments:

  1. ThreemaGateway_Handler_Action_Callback $handler - the callback handler triggering this
  2. Threema\MsgApi\Helpers\ReceiveMessageResult $receiveResult - Threema PHP-SDK receive result.
  3. Threema\MsgApi\Messages\ThreemaMessage $threemaMsg - Threema PHP-SDK message result.
  4. array|string &$output - The output, which is later written to log and potentially shown to Threema. Can be modified, but please only append strings. Array format: [$logType, $debugLog, $publicLog].
  5. bool &$saveMessage - If true the message is saved to the database (default). Can be manipulated to not save the message.
    Note: Even when disabled, the message ID is always saved in the database (for security reasons).
  6. bool $debugMode - Whether the debug mode is activated.

Threema Gateway
Here you can configure the "core" settings of the Threema Gateway.
Threema Gateway - Two-factor-authentication
Here you can configure the two-factor-authentication modes of the Threema Gateway. Please note that the general Threema Gateway settings must be configured before.
Allow GET requests for incoming messages (debug mode)

Usually the Gateway server only sends data via POST request. This option also allows GET requests, which may be useful for debugging.
Note: For security reasons this setting is ignored when XenForo is not running in debug mode.
Download path for files
This is the path where files send to your ID should be saved (in decrypted form!). When no path is given the files are not downloaded (not recommend!). The path must be relative to the XenForo root.
Operation mode
Select the mode you chose when setting up your Threema ID. Without the end-to-end encrypted mode many options may not be available.
Harden replay attack protection

If you are concerned that the Threema server could trick you into maliciously re-delivering you a message, which has already be delivered tick this option. When enabled this may store more data in your database than when it is disabled.
A strong replay-attack protection is always used, so it is not necessary to enable this option. More information can can be found in the FAQ.
Harden HTTPS connection (recommend)
Basic hardening
Enhanced hardening

When sending messages this prevents fallback attacks on the TLS/HTTPS connection by limiting the TLS version and ciphers to modern ones. You may try to set this as high as possible. If you experience problems connecting to the Threema server (e.g. when the credits are not fetched correctly) you know your limit.
No hardening
Use PHP Keystore (not recommend)

By default the database is used to store the public keys of Threema users. When enabling this option you can specify a php file to use. This file must already exist! Note that the file must be stored in library/ThreemaGateway, but you can use relative paths to change this location.
Log incoming messages (debug mode)

When activated this logs all received messages to a path you specify. The path must be relative to the XenForo root.
Note: Please only use this for temporarily for debugging purposes as it dumps secret information to your disk.
When the path is publicly accessible everyone can see every message! For security reasons this setting is ignored when XenForo is not running in debug mode.
Basic mode
End-to-end encrypted mode
Private key file

If you use the end-to-end encrypted mode enter the path to your private key file here. The file must be placed in library/ThreemaGateway. You can however use relative paths to place it somewhere else.
In the wiki you can find an explanation how to do this. You can begin with step 4 as the msgapi tool is already included in library/ThreemaGateway/threema-msgapi-sdk-php/threema-msgapi-tool.php.
Callback for Threema Gateway server

Here you can find your callback URL for the Threema Gateway server, which you need for receiving messages. The access token you can change here should be a random string. It has been randomly generated at the installation of this add-on. You can regenerate it by leaving this field empty.

Automatically lookup mail addresses

When the user activates a 2FA mode this option automatically tries to get the Threema ID associated with the mail address of the user. The mail address is hashed before it is send to the Threema server.
Automatically lookup phone numbers

When the user activates a 2FA mode this option automatically tries to get the Threema ID associated with the mobile phone number of the user. The phone number is hashed before it is send to the Threema server.
Add the ID of the custom user field in the input box, where it should be looked for phone numbers.
Important: When the phone number in this custom user field is not verified when it is saved this allows forum members to lookup arbitrary phone numbers of any Threema user.
Time to block (minutes)
How many minutes the login via the 2FA method should be blocked when a user chooses to do so. This value cannot be configured by a user. It is always the same for each user.
Activate conventional mode
Allow users to use the "Conventional" 2FA method.
Validation time
How long the one time code should be valid. (in minutes)
Validation time when setting up

How long the one time code should be valid when setting up the 2FA method. (in minutes)
It is useful that this value is a bit higher than the previous one, to give the user more time to read through the explanations or similar things. The first setup is assumed to take a bit longer.
Activate fast login mode
Automatically trigger validation

If enabled the submit button is hidden and it is automatically verified whether the validation criteria is satisfied.
If the option is disabled the user has to click the submit button manually.
Blocking options

In the Fast mode users can decline messages. In the setup of the Fast mode users can configure what to do when they do so.
You can configure what users are allowed to do in this case in the permission options for all user groups (at "Threema - Two-step-authentication"). By defaults users can only do some notifications and login blocking and admins and moderators can do everything.
Allows users to use the "Fast login" method
Show QR code of Gateway ID

When enabled this suggests the user to scan the QR code of the Gateway ID. As you usually cannot meet a Gateway ID in person anyway, it is reasonable to offer this.
Note: For security reasons this option is always ignored when HTTPS is not used.
Validation time

How long the message should be able to confirm or decline the message. (in minutes)
The default time limit is so high (compared with the other 2FA modes) as here a long expiration limit does not decrease the security (as the message ID as a stronger secret is used in this mode) and as the expiration limit here also limits the time a user can at maximum decline the message to block a potential (malicious) intruder. Thus it is actually useful to specify a high limit here.
Validation time when setting up
How long the message should be able to confirm or decline the message when setting up the 2FA method. (in minutes)
Activate reversed mode
Automatically trigger validation

If enabled the submit button is hidden and it is automatically verified whether the validation criteria is satisfied.
If the option is disabled the user has to click the submit button manually.
Allow users to use the "Reversed" 2FA method.
Show QR code of Gateway ID

When enabled this suggests the user to scan the QR code of the Gateway ID. As you usually cannot meet a Gateway ID in person anyway, it is reasonable to offer this.
Note: For security reasons this option is always ignored when HTTPS is not used.
Validation time
How long the one time code should be valid. (in minutes)
Validation time when setting up

How long the one time code should be valid when setting up the 2FA method. (in minutes)
It is useful that this value is a bit higher than the previous one, to give the user more time to read through the explanations or similar things. The first setup is assumed to take a bit longer.
Threema Gateway ID
Enter the Threema ID of your Gateway account here. (e.g. *MYAPIID)
Threema ID secret
Enter your secret for accessing the Threema Gateway here.{note}
Note: For security reasons your secret is mostly hidden and will only be changed when you replace the value here.
Verify existence of Threema IDs entered in custom user fields

When this option is deactivated only the format of the Threema ID is verified. If it is activated the Threema server is also queried to check whether the ID really exists.
Note that it is not verified whether the Threema ID belongs to the user.
Use source code of PHP SDK
Instead of using the .phar file this forces the add-on to use the source code of the PHP SDK. This is in most cases only useful for debugging.
Reject old incoming messages

When activated, this verifies the time, when messages are received, so old messages are rejected. The format of the date must be a valid one, which can be processed by strtotime. The date must be a relative one. The recommend minimum value is 20 minutes (-20 min) as the Gateway server retries sending a message for a maximum of 15 minutes. 5 minutes should be a minimum tolerance for server delays.
When disabled a hardcoded fallback to 14 days (-14 days) is used, as messages can never be older than 14 days as they are deleted from the Gateway server.
